headline: Honey Nut Granola
description: It's easy to make your own delicious granola! Mix together your favorite grains, seeds and nuts, then bake.
name: Honey Nut Granola

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

In a large bowl, stir oats, nuts and sunflower kernels together. In a separate bowl, mix together oil, honey, vanilla and cinnamon. Add to dry ingredients; mix well. Spread mixture onto two ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in preheated oven, for 10 minutes, remove from oven and stir. Return to oven and continue baking until golden, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely before storing.

review.reviewBody: Simple, quick an tasty. Still playing with the cooking time and temperature....

With the cost of good granola going through the roof now I decided to start making my own. After looking at many recipes I picked this one and was not disappointed! I used the basic recipe but made my own additions/changes. I added about 3/4 c of ground flaxseed, used coconut oil in place of canola, added about 3 T. of maple syrup to oil/honey mix. I didn't have enough pecans so used what I had and added chopped walnuts to equal the 2 c nuts in recipe, as well as the rest of a bag of roasted/salted pumpkin seeds. Also added about 3/4 t. of salt to oil/honey/syrup mixture. I baked it a total of 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes. Perfect amount of time. Added dried chopped cherries to mix after taking out of oven. It's delicious!
Yummy and super easy!
Great recipe, been using for years. Only change is cooking @ lower temp 250 for 30ish min with stirring every 10

This is amazing granola. My kids and husband eat it like cereal. The only thing I do differently is melt coconut oil instead of the canola oil, and did 1/2 honey and 1/2 pure maple syrup instead of ALL honey (to save on my honey). I cook it longer cause we like it extra crunchy. I love that there's no sugar in this. Guilt-free eating! It's fabulous on yogurt!

It's yummy and super easy to make. I tweaked it a bit. Added walnut pieces and raw pumpkin seeds. Not only do I love it on Greek yogurt and fruit but I also give a small mason jar full as a gift! Enjoy!
I agree with previous posts: more honey is needed. Next time I'll double the honey and add more cinnamon. Could also play around with dry ingredients to mix things up
I skipped the almonds (allergy) and put in puffed quinoa instead. Yum!

This recipe is great! I used slivered almonds and substituted sunflower seeds. Because the slivered almonds are a fair amount larger and it looked a bit dry, I added a tablespoon of honey, which came out well. I used a big pan and a small pan and switched them after the second ten minute shift, then added ten more minutes. The big pan was on top first and I wouldn’t do it the other way around as the result was perfect.
I made some substitutions because I didn’t want to wait for the next day to get the ingredients. It’s great!

I add ginger for a little bite. I also back off on the sunflower seeds and add milled flax seeds. I heat the honey mixture in the microwave so it spreads better. It’s made a HUGE difference. Even the kids like it!
Didn’t taste as good as the ones my mom make.
No changes and yes I will be making it again

This was absolutely wonderful! I wanted a decent granola to give my yogurt some crunch and the store bought stuff way too sweet for me (Type 1 diabetic). This not only filled the bill, but the taste is great!
I did not use wheat germ, used coconut instead, and cut the recipe in half because it is just my husband and myself. I had a difficult time not eating an entire bowl.
Delicious. The kids love it.
Thank you so much for this delicious recipe. I have not purchased any store bought granola since I found your recipe.
Coconut oil instead on canola
I used less honey and used seeds and nuts I had. And once added chocolate chips.

Love this recipe! I've made it before. I'm just reviewing now. I made a couple of additions. I used grapeseed oil because i didn't have coconut oil. Instead of vanilla, I used almond and coconut extract. I added flax seeds, walnuts and flaked coconut. At the end fresh out the oven I added raisins and dried cranberries. I love it! I use as topping for yogurt and ice cream, as cereal and as snack. The uses are many.
Very tasty!

The first time I made the granola, I halved the recipe but put a tsp of dried, minced coconut in since we love the taste of coconut. It was really good! The second time around, we added some cashews, a few tblsp. of dried grated coconut and about 1/4 cup of craisins to the mix, still making half the amount at a time since there are only 2 of us in the house regularly. This recipe can be varied quite a bit and we love this granola. Thank you!
I made it and it was delicious! I covered my cookie sheet with foil and it was sticking to the foil. The second time I made it, I greased the foil with cooking spray and it came out much better.
Increased honey to 2/3 cup, added 1Tb maple syrup; substitute applesauce 1/3 cup plus 2Tb oil for oil

I don't put the volume of nuts in to reduce calories and sprinkle much more cinnamon! I'll add dried cranberries or chocolate chips for variety depending on my mood. I mostly use is on my morning yogurt.
This recipe is simple and delicious. I love it on yogurt!

I probably shouldn't be leaving a review because I made so many changes to it. We were out of granola and this was a "I'm not going to the store, use what we have" moment.
I used 1 cup flax seeds, one cup sunflower seeds, and 1 cup peanuts for the add ins. and then I used coconut oil instead of canola and used a 1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup maple syrup instead of honey. 
The house smelled great and it tastes great.

Delicious and addictive! I’ve made this recipe many times and every time I put it in the oven the whole house smells like cinnamon rolls! Normally I’ll cut the recipe in half because it makes too much for me. This granola isn’t too sweet and it has just the right amount of cinnamon. I definitely would recommend making this granola!
Yummy

A very tasty healthy granola option! You can tasty the difference from the store bought granola! Used almonds, pecans and walnuts and threw in raisins at the end. Baked for 40 minutes, turning every 10 minutes or so. Very happy with this recipe!
Made it a couple of times. I love the cinnamon and honey smell while baking it! My husband loves it! This recipe is so versatile, I just added cranberries and raisins.
This is so much better than store bought granola. I've added golden raisins after baking, I've added pumpkin seeds and different nuts each time I've made it. You can't mess this recipe up.
I love it. I like to add just a touch more honey.

I have made this granola countless times and never do it exactly the same. You can use coconut oil and it’s still great. Add pepitas, cranberries, loads more cinnamon: you can cut back on the honey and it’s still awesome. Thanks for the great recipe! I’ve shared it more than once with friends.
Super easy and yummy breakfast treat. I might make it a bit sweeter in the future. I let them cool on paper towels and squeezed them when cooling as others suggested.
I used pumpkin seeds and walnuts instead of almonds and pecans since I can’t eat those, also used coconut oil....absolutely awesome!

I have made this 4 times and I really like it. Mostly I add fresh fruit and eat it with milk as a substitute for sugar-filled cold cereals. To mix it up I have used maple syrup for the honey and coconut oil for the canola. I always have this on hand for a quick snack.

Great recipe! I've made this several times & we always love it. I've made several variations of this-my most recent was with hazelnuts & mixed dried berries (strawberries, blueberries & cranberries). I've made a tropical version with dried mango & candied ginger with macadamia nuts. Very yummy! I used coconut oil instead of canola and use a mix of sunflower seeds, millet & pepitas instead of straight sunflower seeds. I also up the cinnamon & vanilla and add a bit of salt to enhance the flavors. I add 1/3 cup dried milk at the end - I think that puts it over the top!
I made this granola for my daughter to take on her trip to Paris! I put it in a clear bag, tied it with a bow, added a spoon and viola....breakfast in the morning! Just add milk.

So easy to make, and really tasty! I love having granola on hand to make yogurt parfaits, or for an afternoon snack. I made this as directed (except I used veg oil in place of the canola, because that's what I had on hand.). Lined my baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean up. Granola will crisp up as it cools, so don't worry if it still seems moist when you pull it from the oven. Will make again!
This recipe is great. My first time making granola and I'm thrilled. I added craisins. It's the perfect combination of crunch, nuts, and craisin.
Quick and easy. Tastey

This is the first time I've ever made granola and I liked the way it turned out. Instead of using 1 whole cup of sunflower seeds I used about 2/3 of a cup. Then I used 1/3 of a cup of flax seeds to make it a little more healthy. I'm excited to try it on some Greek yogurt for breakfast tomorrow!

Good good good! Followed the recipe exact with the exception of cashews instead of pecans. After baking for 20 minutes, the mixture was a little too dry so I added another batch of wet ingredients. I was a little worried because it was very moist and wasn't sure it would dry enough to eat it but after another 15 minutes baking and cooled, it turned out great! Next time I may line my baking sheets with parchment paper as the mixture stuck pretty well to my cookie sheets...oh yeah I split the mixture into two batches as it made too much to fit on one sheet. I made one with cranberries and the other with chocolate chips

This is an excellent basic recipe for granola! Like other reviewers, I've adjusted the ingredients with each new batch, using different nuts, cereals, etc., while keeping the "bones" of the recipe - oats, honey, nuts and oil - intact. I highly recommend coconut oil in place of canola/vegetable oil.
Awesome!
Very good. I add coconut for my tastes and whatever variety of nuts I have on hand, and I cook it on parchment longer than stipulated to get it crunchy.

My mom told me about this recipe. She doesn't add the sunflower seeds. I baked this at 7 minutes at a time, mixing in between, to total more than 20 minutes. I had it all on one pan and clumped it up a little at the end to make it more sticky. I added the Trader Joe's cran/blueberry/golden/raisin mix to it after it baked. I used this for teachers' gifts. It's also really yummy with dried strawberries!

I have used this recipe for years and LOVE IT, as does everyone who tries it. Follow the basic steps, then add anything and everything else you'd like. (I don't use cinnamon, as I'm not a fan of it in cereal.)
I like adding coconut, almonds, and flax seed before cooking, then fresh dates when I eat it.

It's great with milk as a cereal or with yogurt and fruit and honey as a dessert.

Good recipe!

I adjusted the recipe a little I put 2 cups of the oats through the food processor. It made the granola have more clusters.

I also prefer other nuts so I used almonds, pecans, cashews, and coconut. I just made the total amount of nuts match the recipe.
Excellent !!!

we really like this! my only change is adding about a half cup of ground flax seed, and reducing the honey to just a tad over 1/3c because we like it not so sweet. it's all we eat for breakfast now - I'm in love!
Easy recipe! If you want add chopped dried fruit to be more chewier and sweeter. Add them at the end when granola is out of the oven and cooling down.
Added chia seeds, pecans, nutmeg. Delicious!! So simple too. Thank you!
I love this recipe. I make it all the time. my favorite way to eat it is on yogurt

Divine! I love how its not super sweet and the cinnamon gives it an incredible punch. I make my own Greek yogurt and this granola is FABULOUS on it. I will never buy prepackaged granola again! Thank you for sharing your recipe. Its pretty amazing!

I've made this twice now, for GIFTS..once just to the recipe's instructions--it was EXCELLENT. The second time I made do with some things on hand (and it was vegan)....still turned out great. 
The second time I used melted coconut oil instead of canola-that was great. I also used agave syrup instead of honey. I personally like it with honey better, but it was very good with agave as well. 
I'm making it again, today, back to the recipe's instructions!
Came out looking nothing like the stock picture but came out good! I like it because it's not ad sweet as store-bought honey granola. I can't wait to top this on my yogurt.
This is delicious! I took the suggestions of others and doubled the honey, and baked on wax paper. Other than that followed the recipe as written. Turned out great!

My family and I love this recipe as is. I had a hard time finding raw sunflower seeds at the grocery store. I had to go to a specialty and health food store. This recipe makes a lot. Be sure to stir often while it is baking. I had to cook mine a little longer than what the recipe says. This is one I will keep forever!

I've made this granola many times, exactly to the recipe. We eat this on yogurt for breakfast most mornings, but family visitors fill bowls and eat it with milk. It's lightly sweetened with the honey, which is the way we like it.
Love love loved it! I just replaced the canola oil with unrefined coconut oil for an healthier snack. It taste great!!

This is an excellent granola....With these modifications..
I use coconut oil instead of canola...I let it get very golden brown.. makes it crispier 
I add mini chocolate chips after it’s cooled.. big hit!!
Wow. This is perfect just as written.
Fantastic granola, better than my favorite boxed one.... cause' i know what i put in it.

quick and easy granola. we love it in parfaits. I didn't use honey but maple (pancake) syrup as my honey had clumped up. bought quick oats and still worked out fine. a nice crunchy, naturally sweet snack.
I love this recipe. Would like to make granola bars with these ingredients. Anyone suggest a recipe?
This is a great recipe. The taste and consistency are very nice. It clumps. My only mistake is I lined my pans with foil. The granola stuck to the foil.
very nice, next time will add less cinnamon, and maybe some sulatnas once it has cooled

Delicious and easy -- except I left mine to cool overnight and woke up to hard-as-rock granola stuck to the middle of the pan. Next time I'll line the pan. I also subbed coconut oil and pumpkin seeds, which were great.

This is the first time I've ever made granola, and it turned out pretty good. I used walnuts & almonds but no sunflower seeds, added some flaxseed and low sugar craisins. I also used pumpkin pie spice instead of cinnamon which gave it a wonderful "fall" flavor, and I baked it a little longer, stirring it often. I would have liked to have it clump together more and will try adding some applesauce as some have suggested.

I love this recipe! It is so perfect in yogurt. The only change i made was to use coconut oil instead of canola. I didnt have any canola oil.
I also found that i had to leave it in the oven a bit longer to make it really crunchy.. My favorite so far.

I love granola and this stuff is delicious! I am not eating processed sugar and the honey works perfectly adding a perfect amoung of sweetness. I added cashews instead of pecans and replaced the canola oil with coconut oil. I put the wet ingredients in a small pot on the stove first. I LOVE this stuff, SO delicious!
I make this all the time with hazelnuts instead of pecans. I also add an extra cup of oats to make it go a little further, but the recipe is perfect as written.
This is the second time I have made it in two weeks! Didn't change the recipe at all and my family lives it!
Great for on the go, very tasty. Just a little messy to eat.

This is a good recipe but in my opinion it could use a bit more honey and i went a little heavy on the cinnamon just a personal preference.Overall this was good But i have a recipe that i like a bit better....

Good recipe. The kids and I liked it. A nice break from the other granolas I have made that are a lot more time consuming. I substituted walnuts for the sunflower seeds and decreased the amount of nuts by a little bit so that I could also add 1/4 cup flax seed and 1/4 cup wheat germ. Will make again!
I increased the honey to 1 cup. I also added whole almonds and pecans instead of chopping them. I added cranraisins and raisins at to the cooling granola.
Super yummy! I did use extra honey but other than that stuck to the recipe.
So yummy! I added flaxseed for an extra boost of healthy.
Very good basic recipe for granola. Makes a lot!

I don't often rate recipes, but this one is worthy. If you buy much granola you know it is much more expensive than the sum of its parts. This is not only outstanding, you can pick your nut addition, I don't always have the exact ones and also use walnuts. I also add a 1/4 cup of flax seed for a little health kick without changing the flavor. I have found that baking it works best for me if I stir it every 10 minutes the first couple of times and then drop back to 7 for the finish laps. I bake my until there is a noticeable color change, I.E. it starts to darken. This makes a granola that breaks up easily and stays that way in storage for me.

author.name: I'm Not Stupid, I Know Tings

review.reviewBody: How about this ... I made the recipe AS STATED & I think its excellent! My intention is to serve it in my yogurt parfait, & oh my goodness, it is to die for.

I'm making this recipe once a week for my family. We all love it! I adjust things to add once baked - dried cranberries, raw cacao nibs, flax seeds...
I always bake on oil-sprayed parchment paper for ease of removal from the sheet and clean up.
Easy and versatile! I use sliced almonds,walnuts, and craisins. It's so good on vanilla ice cream!

This is perfect - even DH who does not like granola loves this recipe. I did a slightly healthier version with gluten free organic oats, peanuts (all I had in the cupboard), only 3T olive oil, 1/3C honey, vegan cocao nibs, cinnamon and craisins and baked it for 25 minutes. DH said that was the reason he liked it was because the oatmeal was crunchy sweet (instead of dry and gummy like store-bought). Thanks for sharing!

Couldn't believe how easy it was to make my own granola. Next time, I would use coconut oil instead and bumping up the honey to 1 cup as I wanted more clumps. I baked mine for 25 mins, making sure to stir every 5 mins as I was paranoid about it getting too toasty.
I have made this granola many times. It is still my favorite, and so quick and easy to make. I usually add about 1/4 cup of coconut. It is especially good on my homemade yogurt.
Didn't have sunflower seeds but it turned out great any way. did add ground flax for a little health kick. This is going to be a staple at out house.
My family loves this recipe. I add coconut for a little extra flavor.

I have made this granola time and time again. Everyone always loves it, its so easy, and it makes a ton so its perfect to bag and give as a gift! I usually substitute walnuts for pecans. I also add 1/4 cup ground flaxseed for nutritional value. I bake for 20 minutes like the recipe suggests but I take it out and stir it every 7 minutes. It seems like 3 minutes wouldn't really make a difference but it does. This can get very brown (borderline burnt) very quickly so I think every 7 minutes is perfect. I bake it on wax paper for easy clean up and as its cooling I add some craisins. Perfect!
I just loved this recipe, every time I need some granola I use this recipe....

First time I've ever reviewed something online. This is my go-to granola and I had to rate it. It's great, in the original recipe form. But best of all... it's sooo easy to make, and so easy to mix-and-match. Just this morning, I put in raw pumpkin seeds, a teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice, and dried cranberries. Still with chopped pecans, too. ( You can never have too many nuts.) I've made it in many ways. Next... I want to try with coconut oil, instead of canola oil. Delicious! Have to make it a couple of times a week.

this came out great!to make it less calories i did a few changes
i halved the recipe. used 2C oats, 1/4C walnuts, 1/4 almonds and a handful of sunflower seeds. i used 2 tbsp of coconut oil(gives awesome flavor) and 2 tbsp honey. i may have cooked mine 5 mins too long bc i didnt think it was brown enough but it came out crunchy with a toasty flavor. i think i would prefer if i made it a lil chewier. have to test that out on the next batch. overall awesome recipe with lots of room for variations with flavors and mixins. thanks! BF loved it too, we have been adding it to our greek yogurt!
Quick. Easy. Delicious. Yum! I can't stop eating it. Added a splash of almond extract when I added the vanilla. Will never buy pre-made granola again.

This was very good granola. I made a 1/2 recipe, to test it, and it did fill the baking sheet I used. I realized the sunflower seeds I bought were seasoned, so I just left them out. I also hand chopped my almonds, and that was fine. I got 6 servings, approximately, with the half a recipe and missing sunflower seeds. I lined the baking sheet with parchment and had no problems with sticking or any issues. This granola is not overly sweet, sticky, or too crunchy like many I have tried. It was fine in milk, but it was excellent on some plain yogurt.
This is to die for! I'm going to add some dried fruit and chocolate to try for a trail mix! I didn't have sunflower seeds so I used raw pumpkin seeds instead. Love it!

The recipe is simple and easy. My granola came out just like the cover picture and tastes really good. I cant believe that I used to pay over $5 for less than this recipe's serving. Thank you for sharing!
This was so yummy on vanilla ice cream!
